TextView.android:text: 1. Organization - As programs grow in complexity, having all the code live inside the main() function becomes increasingly complicated. A function is almost like a mini-program that we can write separately from the main program
2. Reusability -- Once a function is written, it can be called multiple times from within the program. This avoids duplicated code and minimizes the probability of copy/paste errors.

3. Abstraction -- In order to use a function, you only need to know its name, inputs, outputs, and where it lives. You don’t need to know how it works, or what other code it’s dependent upon to use it.
4. Extensibility -- When we need to extend our program, functions allow us to make the change in one place and have that change take effect every time the function is called.
